data.chText: 计划；思想
data.enText: plan/thought

data.chText: 想法；构思；主意
data.enText: a plan, thought or suggestion, especially about what to do in a particular situation

data.chText: 我们出发之前打个电话是个好主意。
data.enText: It would be a good idea to call before we leave.

data.chText: 我喜欢在船上居住的建议。
data.enText: I like the idea of living on a boat.

data.chText: 他已经构思好了下一部小说。
data.enText: He already had an idea for his next novel.

data.chText: 她的家人希望她上大学，但她另有打算。
data.enText: Her family expected her to go to college, but she had other ideas .

data.chText: 那次惊喜聚会是简的主意。
data.enText: The surprise party was Jane's idea.

data.chText: 稍后再试或许是明智的。
data.enText: It might be an idea (= it would be sensible) to try again later.

data.chText: 我们一直有意无意地想着弄条狗。
data.enText: We've been toying with the idea of (= thinking about) getting a dog.

data.chText: 那在当时似乎是个好主意，但后来却铸成大错。
data.enText: It seemed like a good idea at the time , and then it all went horribly wrong.

data.chText: 最近的流行思想是促进妇女对体育的兴趣。
data.enText: The latest big idea is to make women more interested in sport.

data.chText: 印象
data.enText: impression

data.chText: 印象；概念
data.enText: a picture or an impression in your mind of what sb/sth is like

data.chText: 这本小册子详细介绍这家旅馆。
data.enText: The brochure should give you a good idea of the hotel.

data.chText: 我对于这份工作有了一些了解。
data.enText: I had some idea of what the job would be like.

data.chText: 她对我所说的似乎一点也不懂。
data.enText: She doesn't seem to have any idea of what I'm talking about.

data.chText: 我不希望任何人有所误会。
data.enText: I don't want anyone getting the wrong idea (= getting the wrong impression about sth) .

data.chText: 晚上待在家里看电视，我不认为是什么赏心乐事。
data.enText: An evening at home watching TV is not my idea of a good time.

data.chText: 意见
data.enText: opinion

data.chText: 意见；看法；信念
data.enText: an opinion or a belief about sth

data.chText: 他对教育有些非常奇怪的看法。
data.enText: He has some very strange ideas about education.

data.chText: 感觉
data.enText: feeling

data.chText: （认为某事可能发生的）感觉
data.enText: a feeling that sth is possible

data.chText: 是什么让你想到他会来这里？
data.enText: What gave you the idea that he'd be here?

data.chText: 我记得很清楚把它落在哪儿了——但愿我是对的。
data.enText: I have a pretty good idea where I left it─I hope I'm right.

data.chText: 目标
data.enText: aim

data.chText: 目标；意图
data.enText: the aim or purpose of sth

data.chText: 你很快就会明白的。
data.enText: You'll soon get the idea (= understand) .

data.chText: 这个游戏的目的是什么？
data.enText: What's the idea of the game?
give sb ideas
put ideas into sb's head

data.chText: 使某人抱有空想（或做不切实际的事）
data.enText: to give sb hopes about sth that may not be possible or likely; to make sb act or think in an unreasonable way

data.chText: 是谁一直在让他想入非非的？
data.enText: Who's been putting ideas into his head?
have no idea
not have the faintest, first, etc. idea

data.chText: 丝毫不知道
data.enText: used to emphasize that you do not know sth

data.chText: “她在讲什么？”“我一点也不了解。”
data.enText: ‘What's she talking about?’ ‘I've no idea.’

data.chText: 他根本不懂得人事管理。
data.enText: He hasn't the faintest idea how to manage people.
have the right idea

data.chText: 找到好的（或成功的）方式；找对路
data.enText: to have found a very good or successful way of living, doing sth, etc.

data.chText: 他真的想通了——打算在55岁时退休。
data.enText: He's certainly got the right idea─retiring at 55.
that's an idea!

data.chText: 好主意！
data.enText: used to reply in a positive way to a suggestion that sb has made

data.chText: 嘿，好主意！而且我们还可以找支乐队。
data.enText: Hey, that's an idea! And we could get a band, as well.
that's the idea!

data.chText: 干得好；做得对
data.enText: used to encourage people and to tell them that they are doing sth right

data.chText: 对啦！你做得不错。
data.enText: That's the idea! You're doing fine.
you have no idea…

data.chText: 你难以想象…
data.enText: used to show that sth is hard for sb else to imagine

data.chText: 你难以想象今晚的交通有多拥挤。
data.enText: You've no idea how much traffic there was tonight.
buck your ideas up

data.chText: 振作起来
data.enText: to start behaving in a more acceptable way, so that work gets done better, etc.

data.text: purpose ♦ aim ♦ intention ♦ plan ♦ point ♦ idea

data.chText: 以上各词均指意图、目的、目标。
data.enText: These are all words for talking about what sb/sth intends to do or achieve.
purpose

data.chText: 指目的、目标：
data.enText: what sth is supposed to achieve; what sb is trying to achieve

data.chText: 我们这次活动的主要目的是募款。
data.enText: Our campaign's main purpose is to raise money.
aim

data.chText: 指目标、目的：
data.enText: what sb is trying to achieve; what sth is supposed to achieve

data.chText: 她去伦敦是为了找工作。
data.enText: She went to London with the aim of finding a job.

data.chText: 我们的主要目标是增加在欧洲的销售量。
data.enText: Our main aim is to increase sales in Europe.

data.chText: 用purpose还是aim？
purpose指做某事的原因，aim指要达到的目的。aim可以指尝试达到目的，purpose含有要成就某事的强烈感觉。aim可指某人的目的（sb's aim），也可指某事的目的（the aim of sth），purpose更常指做某事的原因（the purpose of sth），也可指某人的目的（sb's purpose），但这样用较正式。
data.enText: Your purpose for doing something is your reason for doing it; your aim is what you want to achieve. Aim can suggest that you are only trying to achieve sth; purpose gives a stronger sense of achievement being certain. Aim can be sb's aim or the aim of sth . Purpose is more usually the purpose of sth : you can talk about sb's purpose but that is more formal.
purpose or aim?
intention

data.chText: 指打算、计划、意图：
data.enText: what you intend to do

data.chText: 我无意去参加婚礼。
data.enText: I have no intention of going to the wedding.

data.chText: 她虽然处处出于善意，却很少产生效果。
data.enText: She's full of good intentions but they rarely work out.
plan

data.chText: 指计划、打算：
data.enText: what you intend to do or achieve

data.chText: 现在没有建新办公楼的计划。
data.enText: There are no plans to build new offices.

data.chText: 用intention还是plan？
intention尤指近期的打算、意图；plan通常但不总是指较长远的计划、安排。
data.enText: Your intentions are what you want to do, especially in the near future; your plans are what you have decided or arranged to do, often, but not always, in the longer term.
intention or plan?
point

data.chText: 指意图、目的、理由：
data.enText: ( rather informal ) the purpose or aim of sth

data.chText: 这些暴行的意图何在？
data.enText: What's the point of all this violence?

data.chText: 本课的目的是比较这两个国家。
data.enText: The point of the lesson is to compare the two countries.
idea

data.chText: 指目的、意图：
data.enText: ( rather informal ) the purpose of sth; sb's aim

data.chText: 我们去的唯一目的就是要见她的新男朋友。
data.enText: The whole idea of going was so that we could meet her new boyfriend.

data.chText: 这背后的意图是什么？
data.enText: What's the idea behind this?

data.chText: 用point还是idea？
point比idea有更多的否定含义：what's the point ...?暗指毫无意义；what's the idea ...?用于真正询问目的。用point而非idea表示对所谈论的事情感到不快：
data.enText: Point is a more negative word than idea. If you say What's the point…? you are suggesting that there is no point; if you say What's the idea…? you are genuinely asking a question. Point , but not idea , is used to talk about things you feel annoyed or unhappy about.
There's no idea in…
I don't see the idea of…
point or idea?
with the purpose/aim/intention/idea of doing sth
sb's intention/plan to do sth
a(n) ambitious/realistic aim/plan
to have a(n) purpose/aim/intention/plan/point
to achieve/fulfil a(n) purpose/aim

ex.chText: 她对自己想要什么只有一个模糊的概念。
ex.enText: She only has a vague idea of what she wants.

ex.chText: 这对新婚夫妇在去哪里度蜜月的问题上有不同的想法。
ex.enText: The newly-weds differed in their idea of where to spend their honeymoon.

synonyms.bx: 最常用词，泛指大脑思维的产物。

ex.chText: 掌握这些基本概念对你来说很重要。
ex.enText: It is important for you to grasp these basic concepts.

ex.chText: 成年人应该有是非观念。
ex.enText: Adults should understand the concept of right and wrong.

synonyms.bx: 指对某事物是什么、怎么做等的想法，通常指抽象概念。

ex.chText: 我对那时的生活是什么样有了一些认识。
ex.enText: I have some conception of what life was like in those days.

ex.chText: 她认为这是对这件事的正确看法。
ex.enText: She believed that this was the correct conception of the matter.

synonyms.bx: 指对某事物的大致理解，侧重概括性。

ex.enText: In my opinion, he is innocent.

ex.chText: 他们征求了厂内工人的意见。
ex.enText: They have asked for the opinion of the workers in the factory.

ex.chText: 与普遍的看法相反，咖啡对人是很有好处的。
ex.enText: Contrary to popular opinion, coffee is quite good for you.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，泛指对某人或某事物的想法。

ex.chText: 谁有什么问题或意见吗？
ex.enText: Does anyone have any questions or comments?

ex.chText: 他对经济改革作出了评论。
ex.enText: He made comments on the economic reform.

synonyms.bx: 指对某人或某事物所发表的意见、见解。

ex.chText: 对于教育他有些相当与众不同的见解。
ex.enText: He had some rather unusual ideas about education.

ex.chText: 她对于抚养孩子的看法很受家长们欢迎。
ex.enText: Her ideas on raising children were popular among parents.

synonyms.bx: 指某人对某事物的看法，通常用复数，常后接介词 about/on。

ex.enText: What is your view/opinion on the school rules?

ex.chText: 他在政治上有鲜明的观点。
ex.enText: He has strong views/opinions about politics.

synonyms.bx: 指个人对某事物的观点或态度，常可与 opinion 换用。

d: 看法，意见。﹝辨析﹞指个人对某事物的观点或态度，常可与 opinion 换用

ex.zh: 主要的主意（或想法）；主要目的
整个的主意（或想法）；整个目的
想出一个主意；获得大致的了解；有一个猜想
有一个主意；有大致的了解；有一个猜想

data.enText: give sb ideas
put ideas into sb's head

data.chText: 使某人抱有空想（或做不切实际的事）
data.enText: to give sb hopes about sth that may not be possible or likely; to make sb act or think in an unreasonable way

data.chText: 是谁一直在让他想入非非的？
data.enText: Who's been putting ideas into his head?
have no idea
not have the faintest, first, etc. idea

data.chText: 丝毫不知道
data.enText: used to emphasize that you do not know sth

data.chText: “她在讲什么？”“我一点也不了解。”
data.enText: ‘What's she talking about?’ ‘I've no idea.’

data.chText: 他根本不懂得人事管理。
data.enText: He hasn't the faintest idea how to manage people.
have the right idea

data.chText: 找到好的（或成功的）方式；找对路
data.enText: to have found a very good or successful way of living, doing sth, etc.

data.chText: 他真的想通了——打算在55岁时退休。
data.enText: He's certainly got the right idea─retiring at 55.
that's an idea!

data.chText: 好主意！
data.enText: used to reply in a positive way to a suggestion that sb has made

data.chText: 嘿，好主意！而且我们还可以找支乐队。
data.enText: Hey, that's an idea! And we could get a band, as well.
that's the idea!

data.chText: 干得好；做得对
data.enText: used to encourage people and to tell them that they are doing sth right

data.chText: 对啦！你做得不错。
data.enText: That's the idea! You're doing fine.
you have no idea…

data.chText: 你难以想象…
data.enText: used to show that sth is hard for sb else to imagine

data.chText: 你难以想象今晚的交通有多拥挤。
data.enText: You've no idea how much traffic there was tonight.
buck your ideas up

data.chText: 振作起来
data.enText: to start behaving in a more acceptable way, so that work gets done better, etc.

tr: an approximate calculation of quantity or degree or worth
example: an estimate of what it would cost
a rough idea how long it would take

tr: the main thing you are thinking about
example: it was not a good idea
the thought never entered my mind
he has an idea that we don't like him
he had in mind to see his old teacher
the idea of the game is to capture all the pieces

tr: (music) melodic subject of a musical composition
example: the theme is announced in the first measures
the accompanist picked up the idea and elaborated it

value.def: An idea is a plan, suggestion, or possible course of action.

example.ex: It's a good idea to plan ahead...
example.tran: 提前做计划是个好主意。

example.ex: I really like the idea of helping people...
example.tran: 我非常赞同帮助他人的提议。

example.ex: She told me she'd had a brilliant idea.
example.tran: 她告诉我她有个好主意。

gramarinfo.label: oft adj N, N to-inf, N <l>of</l> n/-ing

value.def: An idea is an opinion or belief about what something is like or should be like.

example.ex: Some of his ideas about democracy are entirely his own.
example.tran: 他关于民主的一些观点完全是他自己的创见。

example.ex: ...the idea that reading too many books ruins your eyes...
example.tran: 读书过多损害眼睛的看法

example.ex: My idea of physical perfection is to be very slender.
example.tran: 在我看来，要拥有完美身材就要非常苗条。

value.def: If someone gives you an idea of something, they give you information about it without being very exact or giving a lot of detail.

example.ex: This table will give you some idea of how levels of ability can be measured...
example.tran: 这张表格会让你大致了解能力水平可以怎样评估。

example.ex: Could you give us an idea of the range of complaints you've been receiving?...
example.tran: 你能跟我们大致讲一下今年收到的投诉的范围吗？

example.ex: If you cannot remember the exact date give a rough idea of when it was.
example.tran: 如果你记不清确切日期，就说一下大致的时间吧。

value.def: If you have an idea of something, you know about it to some extent.

example.ex: By the end of the week you will have a clear idea of what your eating habits are...
example.tran: 到这周末你便会清楚自己的饮食习惯了。

example.ex: No one has any real idea how much the company will make next year.
example.tran: 没人真的知道该公司明年会赚多少钱。

value.def: If you have an idea that something is the case, you think that it may be the case, although you are not certain.

example.ex: I had an idea that he joined the army later, but I may be wrong.
example.tran: 我猜他后来参军了，但也可能我猜得不对。

value.def: The idea of an action or activity is its aim or purpose.

example.ex: The idea is to encourage people to get to know their neighbours.
example.tran: 其目的是促使人们结识邻居。

value.def: If you have the idea of doing something, you intend to do it.

example.ex: He sent for a number of books he admired with the idea of re-reading them...
example.tran: 他订购了一些自己喜欢的书，打算重新再读一遍。

example.ex: I had to postpone ideas of a career and stay at home.
example.tran: 我不得不暂缓就业打算，呆在家里。

value.def: You can use idea in expressions such as I've no idea or I haven't the faintest idea to emphasize that you do not know something.

example.ex: 'Is she coming by coach?' — 'Well I've no idea.'
example.tran: “她坐长途汽车来吗?”——“哦，我不知道。”

example.ex: We haven't the faintest idea where he is.
example.tran: 我们根本不知道他在哪里。

value.tran: (表示强调)我不知道/我一点儿都不知道

value.def: If someone gets the idea, they understand how to do something or they understand what you are telling them.

example.ex: It isn't  too difficult once you get the idea...
example.tran: 你一旦弄懂了，就不太难了。

example.ex: You're beginning to get the idea.
example.tran: 你开始明白了。

value.def: You can say you have no idea to emphasize how good or bad something is.

example.ex: We are both so happy, you have no idea...
example.tran: 你肯定想象不出来，我们俩都这么幸福。

example.ex: You have no idea how depressed it made me.
example.tran: 你都想象不出这事令我多么沮丧。

value.tran: (强调好或糟糕的程度)你都意想不到，你想象不出

trans: 心中有数；对…一无所知；感到茫无头绪；不想
设计理念；设计思想；设计想法；设计意图；设计概念
大意；中心思想；总体思路；一般概念；一般观念
主题；核心经营理念；中心思想；中心意思；核心理念
大观念；大概念；好主意；大创意；高见
主要意思；两三个次级论点
固执的念头，固定的观念
产生创意；提出想法；创意产生；创意生成；构思产生
